item.title: Medabots Survivors launches February 10 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/medabots-survivors-launches-february-10-in-japan

  • Smartphone

Free-to-play survival action game dated.

Medabots series first survival action game Medabots Survivors will launch for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play as a free-to-play game with in-app purchases on February 10, developer Imagineer announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Recruit Medabots with unique skills and survive against waves of enemies. Both fan-favorite and brand-new Medabots appear in the series’ first-ever survival action game.

The First-Ever Medabots Survival Action Game

Control a variety Medabots with simple controls and survive against waves of incoming enemies. Player decisions such as which Medabots to recruit from your limited forces are your key to victory.

Medabots With Various Skills

Over 30 Medabots will be playable at launch.

  • Eradicate enemies with missiles.
  • Mow down nearby enemies.
  • Set traps to intercept enemies.

Each Medabot possesses its own unique skills to combat the horde. Experience thrilling battles with dramatic turnarounds.

Which skills will the Medabots from the series possess in the game? Stay tuned for future updates!

New Medabots by Popular Illustrators

The protagonist Medabot of Medabots Survivors is designed by Medabots S main illustrator tyuga.

Additionally, the Chang’e-inspired Medabot “Kouga Senjo” designed by Mine Yoshizaki and dark knight-inspired Medabot “Shadow Armor” designed by K-SUWABE also appear.

Additional new Medabots designed by popular illustrators will be be added in the future.

item.title: Sonic Wings Reunion adds PS4 version; debut trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/sonic-wings-reunion-adds-ps4-version-debut-trailer

  • Arcade
  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Hamster Corporation-developed shoot 'em up due out on May 29.

Publisher SUCCESS Corporation and developer Hamster Corporation have released the first trailer for shoot ’em up game Sonic Wings Reunion, as well as announced that it will launch for PlayStation 4 alongside its previously announced PlayStation 5, Switch, PC (Steam), and arcade versions on May 29.

In Japan, the PlayStation 5 and Switch versions will be available both physically and digitally, while the PlayStation 4 version will be digital-only. The game will support English, French, German, Spanish, Portuguese, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

In the year 20XX, cities around the world were attacked.

The mysterious organization “Fata Morgana,” which possesses superweapons and controls the world’s military arsenal with unknown technology, has returned.

The international secret rescue team “Project Blue,” a group of sky-riding knights, stands up against this global threat.

What awaits them as they take the fight to a powerful enemy for various reasons? ……!

Sonic Wings Reunion is a sequel to the arcade-style shooter Sonic Wings. The previous version was sold in 1998.

Choose from eight characters and destroy the mysterious organization “Fata Morgana” that has progressed into the modern world. The scenario changes depending on the combination of characters.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Eight initial characters, with hidden characters unlocked under certain conditions.
  • Eight stages (including bonus stages) to fight in cities and locations in the modern world.
  • Eight stages (including bonus stages) in which players fight in cities and locations in the modern world.
  • Giant futuristic weapons from the original game.
  • Local cooperative play is supported. Conversation scenarios change with cooperative play.
  • The co-op scenarios can be enjoyed in single-player mode as well.
  • Three sound modes are available.
  • The original sound mode is composed by Sonic Wings series sound composer Soshi Hosoi.
  • In the Arrange Sound Mode, the music of previous titles is completely arranged by Japan’s most renowned sound creator. The user can set the music to be played.
  • In Mao Mao mode, Mao Mao’s song is played as background music.
  • The user can select the level of difficulty, invincibility mode, practice mode, and other detailed settings.
  • Support for achievements, leaderboards, and cloud saving.

Watch the trailer below. View a set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics for Xbox One now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/marvel-vs-capcom-fighting-collection-arcade-classics-for-xbox-one-now-available

  • Xbox One

Previously released for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC.

The Xbox One version of fighting game collections Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics is now available via Microsoft Store at a launch discount price of $39.99, Capcom announced.

Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics first launched for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 12, 2024.

Here is an overview of the collections, via Capcom:

About

Join fans from around the world in celebrating the legacy of some of the most beloved fighting games with the release of Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics. This jam-packed collection includes seven timeless games in an all-in-one package, including:

  • X-Men: Children of the Atom
  • Marvel Super Heroes
  • Marvel vs. Capcom: Clash of Super Heroes
  • Marvel vs. Capcom 2: New Age of Heroes
  • Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter
  • X-Men vs. Street Fighter
  • The Punisher

Key Features

  • Battle It Out Online – All of the fighting games in the collection will have online ranked, casual, and lobby matches unlocked for players to showcase their abilities with friends, family, and other players from around the world!
  • Robust Rollback Netcode – Online play for the collection is supported with rollback netcode for a strong and stable online experience!
  • Be the Best! – Global high score leaderboards come to every game in the collection so players can track their journey to the top of the list!
  • Practice Makes Perfect – Training Mode comes to all fighting games in the collection so players can learn, practice, and master their moves!
  • A Rare Gem – The classic beat ‘em up arcade game The Punisher comes to PC and modern consoles for the first time ever in the United States!
  • Watch This! – Spectator Mode is available so you can enjoy watching your friends and co-combatants battle it out!
  • Additional Features – Check out the collection’s enhanced features like a music jukebox, in-game Museum, new display filters, and more!

For Capcom fans, fighting game enthusiasts, comic book and Super Hero aficionados, and everyone in between, Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics offers a timeless celebration of a legacy fighting game series, delivering a diverse roster of iconic characters, enhanced features and competitive gameplay. Relive the nostalgia or discover enduring classics for the first time, uniting fans of all generations in celebration of Capcom’s legendary fighting game series.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Onimusha 2: Samurai’s Destiny remaster announced for PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
Onimusha: Way of the Sword – message from producer Akihito Kadowaki and director Satoru Nihei
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/onimusha-way-of-the-sword-message-from-producer-akihito-kadowaki-and-director-satoru-nihei

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

'Compelling characters, Kyoto setting, and the ultimate sword fighting action.'

Capcom has released a five-minute video message from Onimusha: Way of the Sword producer Akihito Kadowaki and director Satoru Nihei.

Onimusha: Way of the Sword is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam in 2026.

Watch the message below, followed by a full transcript.

Message from the Developers

English

Japanese

Transcript

Akihito Kadokwaki, Producer

“Hello everybody. My name is Karawaki, and I’m producer on Onimusha: Way of the Sword. Thank you for tuning in.

“This title is the newest entry in Capcom’s sword fighting action game series, Onimusha. To add some detail to what we showed in the video, in this game we are taking Onimusha‘s signature sword fighting action and dark fantasy elements, and using Capcom’s latest technology to make this new game as captivating as possible.

“We’re focusing on three core aspects:

  • “Compelling characters, including a new protagonist and enemies that are interesting more than just visually.
  • “The setting of Kyoto, a location brimming with historic spots with mysterious and unsettling backstories.
  • “And lastly, the ultimate sword fighting action. These are the three core aspects we’re working to emphasize in our game.

“Now, I would like to introduce the director of this title, Nihei.”

Satoru Nihei, Director

“Hello. I am the director of Onimusha: Way of the Sword, Nihei. Thank you for your time.

“We decided to set this game in the Edo period of historic Japan. You’ll explore historic locations around Kyoto, such as Kiyomizu-dera Temple, in a heroic tale of a soul samurai fighting against hordes of twisted creatures known as Genma. The protagonist, due to a twist of fate, finds himself wielding an Oni gauntlet. Now in Onimusha, he sets about mowing down the monstrosities roaming the world of the living and feeding their souls to the gauntlet. Through gritty, bloody-soaked brawls, he searches for his reason to fight. What fate awaits at the end of his path?

“Adding our own touches to real-life historical figures, you will meet a cast of unique characters. And in addition to sword battles, drama will unfold in a beautifully eerie depiction of Kyoto.

“Now, to talk about the action of the game. With sword-to-sword combat, we put particular emphasis on the satisfaction of slicing through enemies. As you saw in the footage released, there’s also plenty of soul-sucking action with the Oni gauntlet. By absorbing souls, you can restore your health as well as use special moves. Deciding how to absorb the souls of your enemy in the heat of an intense battle will be the key to victory.

“We’re not trying to make an impossibly difficult game. Instead, we want to make a game where fans of action can experience thrilling sword fights and take satisfaction from slaying their enemies. We sincerely hope you look forward to what we are creating.”

Akihito Kadokwaki, Producer

“The footage we showed earlier was from a short version of the trailer. The full version is available right now on the game’s official website, so we hope you give it a watch. For some regions, gameplay footage was recorded with dismemberment disabled. But please note that dismemberment and blood will be fully featured in the game.”

item.title: Capcom Fighting Collection 2 launches May 16
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/capcom-fighting-collection-2-launches-may-16

  • PC
  • PS4
  • Switch
  • Xbox One

Pre-orders available now.

Classic fighting games collection Capcom Fighting Collection 2 will launch for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on May 16, Capcom announced. Pre-orders are available now.

Users who pre-order the collection will unlock rearranged versions of “Soy Sauce for Geese” and “Rival Schools Medley” by CAP-JAMS, which can be listened to via the in-game Museum. Additionally, a limited number of physical copies will include a Capcom vs. SNK original comic.

Here is an overview of the collection, via Capcom:

About

Combining hard-hitting classics like Capcom vs. SNK 2: Mark of the Millennium 2001 with fan favorite brawlers like Power Stone 2 in one knockout package, Capcom Fighting Collection 2 comes chock-full of new features including online play and quality-of-life updates across all eight games!

Capcom Fighting Collection 2 is a lights-out collection of fighting games and fun-filled classics hitting modern platforms for the first time, including:

  • Capcom vs. SNK: Millennium Fight 2000 Pro
  • Capcom vs. SNK 2: Mark of the Millennium 2001
  • Capcom Fighting Evolution
  • Street Fighter Alpha 3 UPPER
  • Project Justice
  • Power Stone
  • Power Stone 2
  • Plasma Sword: Nightmare of Bilstein
  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Face Off with Friends Online – Online play is available across all eight titles, featuring rollback netcode for a strong and stable online experience!
  • Hit the Training Bag – Training Mode is now available across all titles with tons of customizable options!
  • Expanded Language Support! – 14 languages will be supported including English, Latin American Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese, Japanese, French, Italian, German, Castilian Spanish, Russian, Polish, Korean, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, and Arabic!
  • A Museum’s Worth of Content – Explore art and music galleries with official art, concept art, design documents, and more never-before-seen content.
  • Customize Your Experience – Fine-tune specific features of your gameplay experience via EX Settings specialized to each game, various Display Filters, button customization, and more.
  • Need a Snack Break? – Mid-game saves have now been added!
  • Additional Updates – Various gameplay balance adjustments and quality of life improvements across all eight games.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.
